TextBlock.TextLine: In Antwerpen 18 maj
Gent ncvis Herrebout
Den in gesloten gelieft cito op brugge te senden wenst den selve daer morgen
noen was ofte ten minst morgen avontabso het bestelt waer in niett gelieft
In Antwerpen 19 maij 1681
teversuoneen
Brussel Judouue De sadelaer
monsr. soude volgens ul ordre deroij lakens eerdergesonden hebben dogh sij sijn eerst
lest saturdagh alhier aengekomen als wanneer oock aen ul hebbe versonden in
Een pack ID de welke voor nu hope tot contentement ul sullen sijn geworden
sijmoet kosten N. 413 „ 43 ½ g a 58 a 54 st
voor Rabat a„ 24„16
te betalen netto ƒ 294:16
Minder en kan die niet stellen a governo, soo ul eenigh assignatie heeft
gelieft die te senden volgen ul had geseijt en mij sal orintscheep gescieden
die in alle voorvallende occasie belieft
In Antwerpen maij
Brussel Sabberton
Sr. according I had promised you did not exspect, butt that I should have had
ere now an opportunitie to remitt you what Iow pr rest which I hope shall
do pr next whilst I could wish you would provide acurious parcell of laces
of luped & plaine ground according to the instructions which I'll send you
to marraw, so intrim if you meet an hazard for effs & crawates
of boath sorts pray minde itt, that I may in corridge my freind
to content to I remaine
In Antwarp 20 maij 1681
London Lucy knightley
S. I have recd. yd of 2 & 6 curitt, by the first you seeme to de displeased the
reason I know not: whoever you are free to do what you please whilst IEl
alwayes as know lege yd favour in my behalfe: yd acctt. I ll examin
with more leasure & accept yds bill for £110: & nay when dit: I do not know
what you meane that I should accqvaint my other correspondents with
because no baddy yett know, or shall know that ever I ha any dealing with
you neither am I obliged to give any accompt there ff, except satisfaction
to those that I might. be indebted, which for the present is little ow
nothing in all england for my owne: so if itt be against yd inclination
to have any fuither correspondency with mee tis enough that you are pleased
& I'll take my measures accordingly whilst nevertheless att my time
I yo want more reds if you beclined to settd any
you may be confident that I am
In Antwarp 20 „ maij 1681
ff London pickering & Robinson
Sr. I have before mee yd of 6: curitt as to the sundry bills, now they are
well: I observe you have recd. the bale of tykes N. 14„ butt that you sould
them for little proffitt, for which am sorry, because itt is a com. much
& excreamly demanded here & which I nots so cheap, as can be asforded
in so much that I am well asseured, that no others can bring them in england
for those prijses that I bring them att in yd acctt. yd former ordered 65 peeces
were ready & intended to press them this day: butt receaving yd iustruction
for 75 p do want yett 6 to complent that assortement, which will be
ready this week & sent you bij omert verscrick now in loading for costy
they are all closen, white & curious goods I observe that in the first
pareell I sent you was tike as to a patt: you sent of them I have often
send to England whoever, I will not have you loose by t butt retune
itt freely by some binlander or other, & Ill send and other in steed off
itt, orde good the valew on acctt. I am gladd of what mr. peckerinng
wiites to have taken Effectuall care about our concernes from the
north & that he will be in towne this day so do much liong to
see puttarnes & invoyces of the goods bought as also to winderstand
that they are schipt for I do much want such assortement for
thepresent whilst I rest with hende saluts
London Dueley north
9 In antwerp 20 maij 1681
Sr. I finde my self konoured with yd of 6: curitt, im to which I coved wish
to give you an answer to content, concerning the ardas silke, for which there
is vent here butt what proffitt that those can make which tought up
in London some att 9: 6 I know nott, except itt be out of spiculation
for a rising markett, which for the present I do not appre hend considderin
what ships from Italy are exspected as well in Holland as England
my brother in law is a great dealer in silkes & tells mee that for the
prresent there is butt little in corridgment, butt now & then when one
can waight out the opportunitie, there might besone good to be don
with yett there is here sverall, that have no other trade & live bravely
so that i supose there is mony to be gott by, yett I can not given you so
full an acctt as you desire not beeng so well accquainted in that affaire
& the time to short to have information from the brokers. I knotw
that an english center is 1o bet here & the great pound of 24 ounees
about 23, if I can serve you in any thing you may assure yd self
of the obligation I have to my freind mr. luy knightley which I'll
alknowledge to any of his freinds & demonstrate mij self in all occasions
London Will Scawen
th
S. my last to you was on the 17: curitt sence recd. yd of 6 ditto, as tothe callicoes
though coots had full order to compose the bussynes as well as he could y ett
th
hath not effected, I have iust receaved a letter from him of the 4: when
hewas to meet the same evening with the officiers & hope to adist the
matter, of which shall advise you the succes p next: I am glad you sould the
most part of the laces desiring you to make a dispatch with the rest aswell
as possible, that so I may see how that trade will do suposeing that you fomd
the least packett to content of which please to advise in case you please to
have some tikes more, please also to give yd order, for I have now asmost a pack
ready which is the needfull att present from
28 maij 1681
London Henry maynard -
th
Sr. my last to you was on the 17: curitt, with a remise for £116„ 18„ 1½ for
mij acctt. now have some mony for yd acctt. butt could not do itt under 35:6
af 2 uso, hope to finde yd advantagie pr first I have recd. both yd of 21b
curitt you intend to add to the 60 in ordered cloaths 12 more which shall
be all drabs & low prijses which is well god bethanked that Rogier vande
walle is well arrived, because the branden burgh comissioners are before
oftend againe, so that I could wilh the goods aboard Rothus la mere could
betaken out & shipt for Rotterdam in an Englist ordutch vessel whether
I do desire you to send N. 23 & 24 consigned to my ordre, as hence forward
I will have all bills of loadings to be or indorsed by you to mee & not
to hoots or any other, with an expression to be fore yd acctt and in case uny
goods opened that I might not onely pay no fraight, butt demandgenabtie
for the borges do us a grat deale of preiuduce by opening the packes
which which pray minde in case the 2 bales N. 23 & 24 which I hope will
prove well & for which have given you creditts are shipt before this &
hould not bereshipt for Rotterdam shall, allow you in surance
as also for 22, then you might reclame itt for yd owne, in case any
mis fortume should arrived, butt I rather had these goods shipt for Rott
as above oneles, there was an English vessell for ostend, butt in this
occasions Rotterdam or fishing is the best way. you have ordered in
Hull the providing of the 2 packs of northrens & dosijns which is
well, I do supose that he hath not bought all the dozins yett
where fore ordere him to gett all modecullours about this pat
same an ey eighter & others one cy dacker iusteed of ie cronstall
